item.title: AI-first design patterns - CRUD backend fundamentals
item.description:
this post is part of a series about creating production-grade maintainable AI-first projects, using AI-first design patterns and frameworks. One of the best ways to help our AI agent work on our code, is to help it have a solid feedback loop so it can “plan -> do -> verify” by itself (that’s the base for this post. see earlier posts in the series for more about that).

Turns out that if our code is a backend API service, there are a few basic ideas that have a great ROI.
And we don’t need to invent anything new - there are well-known, established options; we just need to pick ones that fit.
